Secretary: Lilian Ng  (office@mcac-cma.com)"},"body":{"en-US":{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Markham Chinese Alliance Church (MCAC) , part of the Christian and Missionary Alliance in Canada (C&MA), was established in 1991. Initially formed from only a few dozen Cantonese speaking members from the Scarborough Chinese Alliance Church, MCAC has grown over the years to become a vibrant community of over 200 people worshipping Christ in three distinct languages: Cantonese, Mandarin, and English. We aim to build community and care for needs in a holistic fashion, taking care of physical, psychological/emotional and spiritual well-being through God's love for us and our love for all the people of God.

Our Values: Gospel of Christ, Unity in Christ, and the Mission of Christ 
*insert something about these three, I really am not sure about this one either*  

Our Team: *this is where each person will have a picture and a little description of what they do* 
 
Secretary: Lilian Ng (office@mcac-cma.com)

| ---------- | ---------- |
| Rev. Amos Chan       | Senior Pastor        |
| Rev. Timothy Wan       | Mandarin Ministry Pastor       |
| Rev. Bruce Edwards       |     Interim English Ministry Pastor   |
| Pastor David Mok       |    English Ministry Lay Pastor    |
| Pastor Lucinda Tam       | Children's Ministry Pastor      |","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"

    Campers experience a safe and nurturing atmosphere through learning God's Word and His love. Our program offers age appropriate fun activities, which will enrich each child's growth and development in God-like characteristics and values.
- __Pre-teen Leadership Camp__ - Grade 6 to 8 : July 27-31, August 4-7 
     Campers explore and develop the servant leadership through Bible study, team-building games, cooking, and serving the community.
- __AweYsome Arts in Worship Camp__ - Gr 6 to 12 : August 10 - 14
    This arts camp aims to help the youth to realize their artistic gifts come from God, and they can use their gifts as an offering to God in worship. Grounded in the word of God, they will learn to imaging and to create expressions of worship in different art forms such as dance, drama, music, speech, or visual arts. They will be inspired by professional artists and their peers. They will have daily devotions and worship to deepen their relationship with God. They will be encouraged to take what they’ve learned to serve at their own church community.
- __Children Explorer Camp__ - KG - Gr 7 : July 27-31, August 4-7
    This program serves to teach children how to enhance and apply Emotional Quotient (EQ) skills through learning and building interpersonal relationships so they will gain confidence and increase achievement levels.
